name: Cryo Hypostasis
desc:
Cryo Hypostasis

Code name: Daleth. A high-purity Cryo entity.
It doesn't seem all that good at ball sports...

Code name: Daleth. A high-purity Cryo entity.

customize.name: Lucky Coin
customize.desc: Currency verified and used by the Genius Invokation TCG Society. Can be used to purchase various items related to Genius Invokation TCG. It is said that these coins were initially named as such in the hopes that they would bring those carrying them luck. However, perhaps it is those who are sufficiently lucky who are able to possess them...

customize.text: Can also be exchanged using a

customize.name: Blank Dynamic Card
customize.desc: A blank card with a painted back. It is said that if you put the name of your desired dynamic card on this blank card, you can get the very skin from the Association agent located at the tavern.

customize.text: Tavern Challenge: Friendly Fracas - Cryo Hypostasis's Voiceless Cry

<color=#ffd780>Stage Introduction</color>
"Meow." "Some of our companions are quite sensitive to sharp and clear sounds. I've heard that deep in the snowy peaks, such a sound would make your hair stand on end..."
<color=#ccbfad>Special Rule: "Cryo Hypostasis" gains immunity to Frozen, Stun, Petrification and starts with "Elemental Lifeform: Cryo" attached to it. When "Cryo Crystal Core" is triggered, Cryo Hypostasis will be healed to 6 HP. At the start of the Action Phase, trigger the following up to once: If Cryo Hypostasis does not have "Cryo Crystal Core" attached, then attach "Cryo Crystal Core" once more.</color>
<color=#ffffffd9>Opposing Lineup</color>

customize.text: Tavern Challenge: Serious Showdown - Cryo Hypostasis's Rolling Rumble

<color=#ffd780>Stage Introduction</color>
"Meow." "Legends say, that other than those piercing high sounds, that wondrous thing can also roll about on the ground with rumbling sound pitched neither high nor low..."
<color=#ccbfad>Special Rule: "Cryo Hypostasis" gains immunity to Frozen, Stun, Petrification and starts with "Elemental Lifeform: Cryo" attached to it. When "Cryo Crystal Core" is triggered, Cryo Hypostasis will be healed to 10 HP. At the start of the Action Phase, trigger the following up to once: If Cryo Hypostasis does not have "Cryo Crystal Core" attached, then attach "Cryo Crystal Core" once more.</color>
<color=#ffffffd9>Opposing Lineup</color>

value.name: Cryo Hypostasis
value.desc:
Code name: Daleth. A high-purity Cryo entity.
Research suggests that there are subtle differences between elemental hypostases and other elemental life forms in terms of their physical composition. Perhaps these differences can account for their high level of homeostasis and their almost mechanical movements.

desc.text:
<color=#ffd780>Elemental Skill</color>
Deals 3 <color=#99ffff>Cryo DMG</color> . This character gains <color=#ffffff>Overwhelming Ice</color> .
<color=#ece5d8>Overwhelming Ice</color>
<color=#ffd780>Status</color>
<color=#ffffff>When the character uses a Normal Attack:</color> Deal 1 <color=#ffffff>Piercing DMG</color> to all opposing characters on standby .
<color=#ffffff>Usage(s): 1</color>

<color=#ffd780>Elemental Burst</color>
Deals 2 <color=#99ffff>Cryo DMG</color> , deals 1 <color=#ffffff>Piercing DMG</color> to all opposing characters on standby, summons 1 <color=#ffffff>Piercing Iceridge</color> .

<color=#ffd780>Passive Skill</color>
(Passive) When the battle begins, this character gains <color=#ffffff>Cryo Crystal Core</color> .
<color=#ece5d8>Cryo Crystal Core</color>
<color=#ffd780>Status</color>
<color=#ffffff>When the character to which this is attached would be defeated:</color> Remove this effect, ensure the character <color=#ffffff>will not be defeated</color> , and heal them to 1 HP.

<color=#ffd780>Summon</color>
<color=#ffffff>End Phase:</color> Deal 1 <color=#99ffff>Cryo DMG</color> to the opposing <color=#ffffff>Character Closest to Your Current Active Character</color> .
<color=#ffffff>Usage(s): 2</color>

Applies Cryo and can trigger the following Elemental Reactions:
<color=#ffffff>[</color> <color=#99ffff>Cryo</color> + <color=#ff9999>Pyro</color> <color=#ffffff>]</color> <color=#ffffff>Melt</color> : DMG +2 for this instance
<color=#ffffff>[</color> <color=#99ffff>Cryo</color> + <color=#ffacff>Electro</color> <color=#ffffff>]</color> <color=#ffffff>Superconduct</color> : DMG+1 for this instance, deal 1 Piercing DMG to all opposing characters except the target
<color=#ffffff>[</color> <color=#99ffff>Cryo</color> + <color=#80c0ff>Hydro</color> <color=#ffffff>]</color> <color=#ffffff>Frozen</color> : DMG +1 for this instance, the target is unable to perform any Actions this Round (Can be removed in advance after the target receives Physical or Pyro DMG, in which case they will take +2 DMG)

<color=#ece5d8>Piercing DMG</color>
Piercing DMG cannot be increased by any bonuses, but cannot be defended against using Shields or DMG Immunity either.
<color=#ece5d8>Usage(s)</color>
After this card's effect is triggered, 1 <color=#ffffff>Usage</color> of it will be consumed.
This card will be discarded immediately once it has 0 <color=#ffffff>Usages</color> remaining.
<color=#ece5d8>Character Closest to Your Current Active Character</color>
The opposing "character closest to your current active character" is the opposing character whose position is closest to that of your active character.
If multiple such characters exist, the one with the foremost position will be viewed as being "closest."
<color=#ece5d8>Immunity to Defeat</color>
Certain effects will grant characters an <color=#ffffff>immunity to being defeated</color> when their HP hits 0, and will heal them for a certain amount thereafter.
When this occurs, characters will not be regarded as having experienced a <color=#ffffff>defeat.</color> (Hence, their attached equipment and statuses will not be removed, and their Energy will remain uncleared.)
